title: HexaPent
content: [](http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/1134/545/1600/30freq.png)Four freedoms of the global grid:  to vary frequency, orientation, altitude, to fold/unfold.  The viewer has yet additional freedoms.The latitude/longitude grid gives the illusion of regular quadrilaterals (squares) nearest the equator, and furthest from the two poles where longitudinal gore tips meet.The global matrix, backward-compatible with lat/long, gives the illusion of regular hexagons in regions furthest from the 12 pentagons.  Irregularities are more evenly distributed.Both grids fold/unfold, using various algorithms e.g. [Fuller's](http://www.grunch.net/synergetics/map/dymax.html) and [Snyder's](http://www.bfi.org/node/555).Related links:[Fuller's Geoscope Project](http://bfi.org/node/564) (global data displays)[Glenn Stockton's Global Matrix Project](http://mathforum.org/kb/message.jspa?messageID=4846829) (Math Forum citation)
author: Kirby Urner
